q1_general_response: {"answer": "Based on the image, it appears you have a mole or pigmented lesion on your skin. It's a brown patch with slightly irregular borders and some variation in color within the lesion. While it's difficult to determine the exact nature without a closer examination, these features warrant further evaluation to rule out any atypical or concerning characteristics. I recommend we perform a thorough skin examination and possibly dermoscopy (a magnified view of the lesion) to assess it more closely. In some cases, a biopsy might be necessary to get a definitive diagnosis. It's important to monitor any changes in size, shape, color, or symptoms like itching or bleeding and report them to me promptly."}
q2_dataset_response: {"answer": "Based on the visual features, it is difficult to definitively determine if this lesion/skin disease is harmful. Further examination and possibly a biopsy would be needed for a proper diagnosis."}
q1_general_question: How would you explain the lesion/disease in this image to a worried patient?
